Rationale

By Jason Dumont

What did I aim to make?

I aimed to make a sunset scene, incoporating a wild theme with a peaceful setting. A house set upon a cliff edge living in the wild!

Why did I choose this

The choice of a sunset scene in the wild allowed me to utilise all the relevent canvas functions, ranging from lineTo to bezier curves. This allowed me to increase my overall knowledge of canvas techniques.

Another benefit of the style of scene I went for is that it is built up of the same objects in aspects, this means that I was able to place the drawing of elements into functions, this aided in the animation of the materials later.

In terms of colouring the pieces I was able to do this by creating a range of new paths at points to provide the sense of depth.

Another benefit is from being outside it allowed me to test out the effects of rain and clouds, both with different needs in terms of movement. This added a level of complexity to the code however was manageable with the use of JSON objects to store appropriate data bout each object

The one downside of drawing so many elements every 10ms is that this can cause lag in the animation which produces a flicker or flash effect, to remove this would involve reducing the amount of elements being drawn on the page
